name: pinto bean seed production, for sowing | pinto bean seed, for sowing | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27359/documentation

The process prepares and produces seeds for sowing. Refers to 1 kg of pinto bean seed (fresh weight).

This activity start after the harvest of the crop.

The seed produced at the farm is treated in the processing centre (pre-cleaning, cleaning, eventually drying, chemical dressing (for integrated production) and bag filling), stored and afterwards transported to the regional storage centre. No data on wastewater production were available.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0164:Seed processing for propagation

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Date of the major data sources.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolated from 'pea seed production, for sowing'.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data based on a literature, expert information and enquiry of seed processing plants.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of pea seed, for sowing is calculated to be circa 1.60E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.20E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
